thread.title: Mark Scheifele remains hot as Jets beat Blues
thread.title_full: Mark Scheifele remains hot as Jets beat Blues

author: Associated Press
title: Mark Scheifele remains hot as Jets beat Blues
text:
Presented by: Mark Scheifele remains hot as Jets beat Blues 
Winnipeg Jets' Nikolaj Ehlers, of Denmark, is congratulated by teammates after scoring during the second period against the Blues. (Jeff Roberson/AP)  54  54 PM 
ST. LOUIS — Mark Scheifele had a goal and an assist, Jacob Trouba scored a key third-period goal, and the Winnipeg Jets beat the St. Louis Blues 5-3 on Tuesday night. 
Patrik Laine, Nikolaj Ehlers and Blake Wheeler also scored for the Jets, who improved to 12-4-1 within the Central Division and 3-0 against the Blues. Ondrej Pavalec made 24 saves. #NHLJets Mark Scheifele has 9 points (3 G, 6 A) in his last 7 games 
— Sportsnet Stats (@SNstats) February 1, 2017 
Alexander Steen, Vladimir Tarasenko, Alex Pietrangelo scored for the Blues, who lost their fourth straight on home ice. Jake Allen made 19 saves. More from Sportsnet
